text:
Hi Ecology. Working through ported  projects like StatisticalRethinking.jl has been a really great way to build familiarity in julia, especially with probabilistic programming.

Bayesian Population Analysis (kery / schaub) has been ported in Stan, has anyone come across efforts to port BPA in Julia/turing?

elements.text:
Hi Ecology. Working through ported  projects like StatisticalRethinking.jl has been a really great way to build familiarity in julia, especially with probabilistic programming.

Bayesian Population Analysis (kery / schaub) has been ported in Stan, has anyone come across efforts to port BPA in Julia/turing?

text: Hi <@U01KZUF5VQF>, I'm playing around with Turing for some Ecological model. It could be great to have BPA translated in Julia/Turing. I know they teach it with JAGS on R (no more WinBUGS), so could be nice to compare. If you are going to start such project I'll enjoy to help!

elements.text: , I'm playing around with Turing for some Ecological model. It could be great to have BPA translated in Julia/Turing. I know they teach it with JAGS on R (no more WinBUGS), so could be nice to compare. If you are going to start such project I'll enjoy to help!

text: Also, they plan to release this year a new book "Integrated Population Models: Theory and Ecological Applications With R and Jags"

elements.text: Also, they plan to release this year a new book "Integrated Population Models: Theory and Ecological Applications With R and Jags"
